channel.title: trashpanda.draws TikTok
channel.description: OK Boomer, all the latest TikToks from trashpanda.draws

item.title: I wrote this bootcamp for myself but I figured I‚Äôd share what I‚Äôm doing every day incase anyone wanted to follow along, see how I study, or just needs ideas/motivation. If you decide to follow along and post it tag me so I can come see all your awesome a

item.title: Day 210 done! Today was also a day 1 of my Art Boot Camp! Today was honestly a bunch of different types of gesture drawing. And I am really happy with how they came out. I found drawing the seals and sea lions very helpful in getting proper curves drawn i

item.title: Day 211 done! Today was amazing practice at drawing with my entire arm/shoulder. I did not count the number of circles I drew, but it was a lot. I do feel like today was good at helping my brain turn the head base in 3D space and get that ever tricky unde

item.title: The warm ups are the same but then we get into the Loomis head and working on seeing things more 3 dimensional. Draw with your arm and your circles will look like circles! üòÅ #trashpandadraws #teachingmyselfhowtodraw #gettingbackintodrawing #gesturedrawing
item.description: The warm ups are the same but then we get into the Loomis head and working on seeing things more 3 dimensional. Draw with your arm and your circles will look like circles! üòÅ #trashpandadraws #teachingmyselfhowtodraw #gettingbackintodrawing #gesturedrawing

item.title: Day 212 done! Today was a great review on torso anatomy. I think I need to do a dedicated back day where I draw the muscles and then hide my reference and then redraw and see what I was able to remember and repeat until I understand those muscles better.
item.description: Day 212 done! Today was a great review on torso anatomy. I think I need to do a dedicated back day where I draw the muscles and then hide my reference and then redraw and see what I was able to remember and repeat until I understand those muscles better.

item.title: Torsos! The warm ups are the same just less. I want to make sure I‚Äôm drawing heads and gestures every day to keep in practice. Pay close attention to how the muscles get stretched and squashed depending on how the arms move and how the torso bends. #tra
item.description: Torsos! The warm ups are the same just less. I want to make sure I‚Äôm drawing heads and gestures every day to keep in practice. Pay close attention to how the muscles get stretched and squashed depending on how the arms move and how the torso bends. #tra

item.title: Necks! Warmups are the same as yesterday. Make sure you‚Äôre drawing heads on the necks we want to be able to connect the forms. Draw the traps in. If you can draw the collarbone on the torso and you can draw it on the neck then you can draw a neck on the
item.description: Necks! Warmups are the same as yesterday. Make sure you‚Äôre drawing heads on the necks we want to be able to connect the forms. Draw the traps in. If you can draw the collarbone on the torso and you can draw it on the neck then you can draw a neck on the

item.title: Day 214 done! I know when most people go through anatomy they go top down. Head, neck, torso, arms, hands, legs, feet. But I‚Äôve technically already been through all of this once and I did it in that order. And I found that because I didn‚Äôt learn certain t

item.title: Planting Your Character/Feet! Warmups are the same as yesterday. Today is not so much about getting the proper anatomy of the foot memorized. But rather finding a consistent way to be able to place the entire foot on the ground plane in proper perspecti
item.description: Planting Your Character/Feet! Warmups are the same as yesterday. Today is not so much about getting the proper anatomy of the foot memorized. But rather finding a consistent way to be able to place the entire foot on the ground plane in proper perspecti

item.title: Day, 215 done! Today was all about arms, more specifically the forearm. Understanding how the forearm connects and how it twists and how all of those muscles work can be a little bit tricky. But I think I have a much better understanding of all of it all

item.title: Figure drawing instead of portraits because we‚Äôre focusing on the face today. Mouth, Teeth, Lips! Pay attention to how things curve and are foreshortened because of it. The jaw is a hinge and remember when the mouth is open the lips get stretched across
item.description: Figure drawing instead of portraits because we‚Äôre focusing on the face today. Mouth, Teeth, Lips! Pay attention to how things curve and are foreshortened because of it. The jaw is a hinge and remember when the mouth is open the lips get stretched across

item.title: Short face studies are back! Different body types. You kinda off have to learn to be conscious of asking variation into your drawings when it comes to drawing different body types and different facial features. Use reference build up your visual library
item.description: Short face studies are back! Different body types. You kinda off have to learn to be conscious of asking variation into your drawings when it comes to drawing different body types and different facial features. Use reference build up your visual library
